entry.title: Re 9/ Differences between PoW and PoS 🤔 Penalty for submitting invalid info ❌ - PoW - Computing power, energy, and time - PoS - Validator’s crypt...
entry.summary: Re 9/ Differences between PoW and PoS 🤔 Penalty for submitting invalid info ❌ - PoW - Computing power, energy, and time - PoS - Validator’s crypto funds serve as an incentive to act in the network’s best interest

entry.title: Re 8/ The PoS model allows #crypto owners to #stake their coins and create their own validator nodes Staking is when you pledge your coins to be used ...
entry.summary: Re 8/ The PoS model allows #crypto owners to #stake their coins and create their own validator nodes Staking is when you pledge your coins to be used for verifying if the transactions in the block are accurate

entry.title: Re 7/ PoS’s system works similarly to PoW’s where a network participant is selected to add the latest pieces of transactions into the blockchain and...
entry.summary: Re 7/ PoS’s system works similarly to PoW’s where a network participant is selected to add the latest pieces of transactions into the blockchain and earn crypto in exchange 🙌

entry.summary: Re 6/ Proof of Stake 🧬 🔌 Powers #Ethereum 2.0, #Polygon and many other newer cryptocurrencies With ETH 2.0 planned to come out in 2022, the upgraded version of the blockchain will allow faster and less resource intensive consensus mechanism - called Proof of Stake ⚡
